018package com.scivicslab.actoriac;
019
020import java.util.List;
021import java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService;
022
023import com.github.ricksbrown.cowsay.Cowsay;
024import com.scivicslab.actoriac.log.DistributedLogStore;
025import com.scivicslab.actoriac.log.LogLevel;
026import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.core.ActorRef;
027import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.IIActorSystem;
028import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.Interpreter;
029import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.Transition;
030
031/**
032 * Level 3 wrapper that adds workflow capabilities to a NodeGroup POJO.
033 *
034 * <p>This class extends {@link Interpreter} to provide workflow execution
035 * capabilities while delegating node group operations to a wrapped {@link NodeGroup} instance.</p>
036 *
037 * <p>This follows the same three-level architecture as NodeInterpreter:</p>
038 * <ul>
039 * <li><strong>Level 1 (POJO):</strong> {@link NodeGroup} - pure POJO with inventory management</li>
040 * <li><strong>Level 2 (Actor):</strong> ActorRef&lt;NodeGroup&gt; - actor wrapper for concurrent execution</li>
041 * <li><strong>Level 3 (Workflow):</strong> NodeGroupInterpreter - workflow capabilities + IIActorRef wrapper</li>
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <p><strong>Design principle:</strong> NodeGroup remains a pure POJO, independent of ActorSystem.
045 * NodeGroupInterpreter wraps NodeGroup to add workflow capabilities without modifying the NodeGroup class.</p>
046 *
047 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
048 */
049public class NodeGroupInterpreter extends Interpreter {
050
051    /**
052     * The wrapped NodeGroup POJO that handles inventory and node creation.
053     */
054    private final NodeGroup nodeGroup;
055
056    /**
057     * The overlay directory path for YAML overlay feature.
058     * When set, workflows are loaded with overlay applied.
059     */
060    private String overlayDir;
061
062    /**
063     * Verbose output flag.
064     * When true, displays full YAML for each transition instead of truncated version.
065     */
066    private boolean verbose = false;
067
068    /**
069     * Actor reference for the distributed log store.
070     * Used to send log messages asynchronously to avoid blocking workflow execution.
071     */
072    private ActorRef<DistributedLogStore> logStoreActor;
073
074    /**
075     * Direct reference to the log store for synchronous read operations.
076     * Reads don't need to go through the actor since they don't need serialization.
077     */
078    private DistributedLogStore logStore;
079
080    /**
081     * Dedicated executor service for DB writes.
082     * Should be a single-threaded pool to ensure serialized writes.
083     */
084    private ExecutorService dbExecutor;
085
086    /**
087     * Session ID for the current workflow execution.
088     */
089    private long sessionId = -1;
090
091    /**
092     * Constructs a NodeGroupInterpreter that wraps the specified NodeGroup.
093     *
094     * @param nodeGroup the {@link NodeGroup} instance to wrap
095     * @param system the actor system for workflow execution
096     */
097    public NodeGroupInterpreter(NodeGroup nodeGroup, IIActorSystem system) {
098        super();
099        this.nodeGroup = nodeGroup;
100        this.system = system;
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * Creates Node objects for all hosts in the specified group.
105     *
106     * <p>Delegates to the wrapped {@link NodeGroup#createNodesForGroup(String)} method.</p>
107     *
108     * @param groupName the name of the group from the inventory file
109     * @return the list of created Node objects
110     */
111    public List<Node> createNodesForGroup(String groupName) {
112        return nodeGroup.createNodesForGroup(groupName);
113    }
114
115    /**
116     * Creates a single Node for localhost execution.
117     *
118     * <p>Delegates to the wrapped {@link NodeGroup#createLocalNode()} method.</p>
119     *
120     * @return a list containing a single localhost Node
121     */
122    public List<Node> createLocalNode() {
123        return nodeGroup.createLocalNode();
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * Gets the inventory object.
128     *
129     * @return the loaded inventory, or null if not loaded
130     */
131    public InventoryParser.Inventory getInventory() {
132        return nodeGroup.getInventory();
133    }
134
135    /**
136     * Gets the wrapped NodeGroup instance.
137     *
138     * <p>This allows direct access to the underlying POJO when needed.</p>
139     *
140     * @return the wrapped NodeGroup
141     */
142    public NodeGroup getNodeGroup() {
143        return nodeGroup;
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * Sets the overlay directory for YAML overlay feature.
148     *
149     * <p>When an overlay directory is set, workflows will be loaded with
150     * overlay applied, allowing environment-specific configuration.</p>
151     *
152     * @param overlayDir the path to the overlay directory containing overlay-conf.yaml
153     */
154    public void setOverlayDir(String overlayDir) {
155        this.overlayDir = overlayDir;
156    }
157
158    /**
159     * Gets the overlay directory path.
160     *
161     * @return the overlay directory path, or null if not set
162     */
163    public String getOverlayDir() {
164        return overlayDir;
165    }
166
167    /**
168     * Sets verbose mode for detailed output.
169     *
170     * <p>When enabled, displays full YAML for each transition in cowsay output
171     * instead of the truncated version.</p>
172     *
173     * @param verbose true to enable verbose output
174     */
175    public void setVerbose(boolean verbose) {
176        this.verbose = verbose;
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * Checks if verbose mode is enabled.
181     *
182     * @return true if verbose mode is enabled
183     */
184    public boolean isVerbose() {
185        return verbose;
186    }
187
188    /**
189     * Sets the distributed log store for structured logging.
190     *
191     * <p>Database writes are performed asynchronously via the logStore actor
192     * using the dedicated dbExecutor to avoid blocking workflow execution.
193     * Direct reads can use the logStore reference directly.</p>
194     *
195     * @param logStore the log store instance (for direct reads)
196     * @param logStoreActor the actor reference for the log store (for async writes)
197     * @param dbExecutor the dedicated executor service for DB writes
198     * @param sessionId the session ID for this execution
199     */
200    public void setLogStore(DistributedLogStore logStore,
201                            ActorRef<DistributedLogStore> logStoreActor,
202                            ExecutorService dbExecutor, long sessionId) {
203        this.logStore = logStore;
204        this.logStoreActor = logStoreActor;
205        this.dbExecutor = dbExecutor;
206        this.sessionId = sessionId;
207    }
208
209    /**
210     * Gets the log store for direct read operations.
211     *
212     * @return the log store, or null if not set
213     */
214    public DistributedLogStore getLogStore() {
215        return logStore;
216    }
217
218    /**
219     * Gets the log store actor for async write operations.
220     *
221     * @return the log store actor, or null if not set
222     */
223    public ActorRef<DistributedLogStore> getLogStoreActor() {
224        return logStoreActor;
225    }
226
227    /**
228     * Gets the DB executor service.
229     *
230     * @return the DB executor service, or null if not set
231     */
232    public ExecutorService getDbExecutor() {
233        return dbExecutor;
234    }
235
236    /**
237     * Gets the session ID.
238     *
239     * @return the session ID, or -1 if not set
240     */
241    public long getSessionId() {
242        return sessionId;
243    }
244
245    /**
246     * Hook called when entering a transition during workflow execution.
247     *
248     * <p>Displays the workflow name and transition definition using cowsay.
249     * In normal mode, shows first 10 lines. In verbose mode, shows the full YAML
250     * after the cowsay output.</p>
251     *
252     * @param transition the transition being entered
253     */
254    @Override
255    protected void onEnterTransition(Transition transition) {
256        // Get workflow name
257        String workflowName = (getCode() != null && getCode().getName() != null)
258                ? getCode().getName()
259                : "unknown-workflow";
260
261        // Get YAML-formatted output (first 10 lines for cowsay)
262        String yamlText = transition.toYamlString(10).trim();
263
264        // Combine workflow name and transition YAML
265        String displayText = "[" + workflowName + "]\n" + yamlText;
266        String[] cowsayArgs = { displayText };
267        System.out.println(Cowsay.say(cowsayArgs));
268
269        // In verbose mode, show the full YAML after cowsay
270        if (verbose) {
271            String fullYaml = transition.toYamlString(-1);
272            System.out.println("--- Full transition YAML ---");
273            System.out.println(fullYaml);
274            System.out.println("----------------------------");
275        }
276
277        // Log to distributed log store asynchronously
278        if (logStoreActor != null && sessionId >= 0) {
279            String label = transition.getLabel();
280            if (label == null && transition.getStates() != null && transition.getStates().size() >= 2) {
281                label = transition.getStates().get(0) + " -> " + transition.getStates().get(1);
282            }
283            final String finalLabel = label;
284            final String message = "Entering transition: " + yamlText.split("\n")[0];
285            // Fire-and-forget: don't wait for DB write to complete
286            logStoreActor.tell(
287                store -> store.log(sessionId, "nodeGroup", finalLabel, LogLevel.INFO, message),
288                dbExecutor);
289        }
290    }
291}
